# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description
The API docs (https://angular.io/api/core/DebugElement) for `DebugElement` are barren. It's just a bunch of properties and methods with no comments, guidance, information, etc.

At minimum, it should link to https://angular.io/guide/testing#debugelement. But it really should have some basic comments on what these properties and methods can be used for. It's likely that the testing guide could be used to reverse engineer comments to add to the interface (API docs).

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/api/core/DebugElement

### Reproduction Steps**
See description.

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
API docs are expected to have basic comments, guidance, and examples. Actual API docs for `DebugElement` have none of this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs: DebugElement interface needs API docs" (#36048)

Issues.Body:

in a microsyntax expression to `ParsedVariable`, and subsequently to

Note that this commit does not propagate the `keySpan`, because it involves
significant changes to the template AST.

Issues.Title: build: ng_rollup_bundle internal rule should support ngcc
Issues.Body:
The `ng_rollup_bundle` rule currently is only consumed in the
Angular framework repository. This means that Angular packages
are built from source, and ngcc is never needed to build rollup
bundles using Ivy.

Though, this rule is planned to be shared with other repositories
to support common benchmark code. This means that ngcc needs to be
handled as these other repositories cannot build Angular from source,
but instead consume Angular through NPM (with ngcc enabling Ivy).

The `ng_rollup_bundle` rule needs to dynamically prioritize `ngcc`
generated main resolution fields if `--define=angular_ivy_enabled=True`
is set (or with the alias: `--config=ivy`).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: ng_rollup_bundle internal rule should support ngcc" (#36044)

Issues.Title: Serving an app with --prod which uses a lib that has a cyclic dependency and not built with --prod doesn't work
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Not really sure, I'm guessing it's something that reproduces when the build optimizer is activated. The problem might be there, or in the compiler. ### Is this a regression? Yes, with 8.2.13 this wasn't a problem. ### Description I generated a library project (`ng g lib cyclic`) in which I created two components with a cyclic dependency: ParentComponent includes ChildComponent in its template, while ChildComponent injects ParentComponent. In the app component, the ParentComponent is used in the template with the *ngIf directive bound to a flag that is set to true when a button is clicked. If I build the library project (`ng build cyclic`) without the --prod flag, then serve the app with the --prod flag, when clicking the button, the component does not appear. Debugging the problem, it seems that when creating the TView of the ParentComponent, the directiveRegistry is null, and the flags are 0, so Angular does not see the associated node as a component. I noticed that if I serve the app without the --prod flag, after the module, a call to `…µ…µsetComponentScope` is inserted. This is done, as I understand it, in cases of cyclic dependencies. However, when serving with the --prod flag, this call is not there, and that's why the flags are not set, and directiveRegistry is null. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/AndreiVajnaII/ivy-cyclic-dependency-in-lib-production-bug ``` npm i ng build cyclic ng serve --prod ``` Click the "Show" button. The text "child" should appear, but nothing happens. Workaround: `ng build cyclic --prod` instead. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.0.6
Node: 10.15.3
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.0.6
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: FormsModule has not been processed correctly by ngcc, or is not compatible with Angular Ivy
Issues.Body:
Hi,

I updated my angular 7 project with

>ng update @angular/cli @angular/core --allow-dirty.

right now when i run the project below error is displayed.

```
_ERROR in Failed to compile entry-point angular-tabs-component (module as esm5) due to compilation errors:
node_modules/@angular/forms/forms.d.ts:2699:22 - error NG6002: Appears in the NgModule.imports of TabModule, but could not be resolved to an NgModule class.

This likely means that the library (@angular/forms) which declares FormsModule has not been processed correctly by ngcc, or is not compatible with Angular Ivy. Check if a newer version of the library is available, and update if so. Also consider checking with the library's authors to see if the library is expected to be compatible with Ivy._
```

Issues.Title: ResolvingGuards
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/router


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Right now the route guards only resolve to a boolean. An activation can be blocked or not. Next the resolver are called but they are not able to block a new route getting loaded. In my scenario an item from a dialog is resolved with my route. If the user cancels the dialog the route should not get executed.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> As far as I've read returning an Observable that gets completed before next was called canceled the navigation for old Angular versions? That behavior would just fit my requirements. Or the functionality of guards and resolvers could get merged so that a resolve result could be set by the guards.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Right now I need to use a guard and store the result in a static variable or re-navigate to the current url in the resolver - both solutions are a bit dirty.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ResolvingGuards" (#36030)

Issues.Title: fix(zone.js): zone.js patch jest should handle done correctly
Issues.Body:
`zone.js` support jest `test.each()` methods, but it
introduces a bug, which is the `done()` function will not be handled correctly.

```
it('should work with done', done => {
  // done will be undefined.
});
```

The reason is the logic of monkey patching `test` method is different from `jasmine` patch

// jasmine patch
```
return testBody.length === 0
   ? () => testProxyZone.run(testBody, null)
   : done => testProxyZone.run(testBody, null, [done]);
```

// jest patch
```
 return function(...args) {
   return testProxyZone.run(testBody, null, args);
 };
```

the purpose of this change is to handle the following cases.

```
test.each([1, 2])('test.each', (arg1, arg2) => {
  expect(arg1).toBe(1);
  expect(arg2).toBe(2);
});
```

so in jest, it is a little complex, because the `testBody`'s parameter may be bigger than 1, so the
logic in `jasmine`

```
return testBody.length === 0
   ? () => testProxyZone.run(testBody, null)
   : done => testProxyZone.run(testBody, null, [done]);
```
will not work for `test.each` in jest.

So in this PR, I created a dynamic `Function` to return the correct length of paramters (which is required by jest core), to handle
1. normal `test` with or without `done`.
2. each with parameters with or without done.

Issues.Title: Including (instagram) Scripts breaks Angular Router
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

The URLs of the website are changing when clicking on router links, but the application is not loading a new page.

### Description

My customer wants to include an Instagram Module that shows different pictures and opens a modal on click. (we tried https://getflowbox.com/ and https://squarelovin.com/ )

Nothing fancy, but something that we cant just use an iframe for because of its "global" impact like opening a modal etc.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Our Application is pretty extensive. Theres also no way for me to legally show you the code. But its an angular application, the error also occurs if you exclude everything else on the side. Happens for multiple scripts.

## üî• Exception or Error

Clicking on links does not redirect you. No console errors, loads page if you do a hard reload.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
Angular 8.2

**Anything else relevant?**
Chrome 80.0

Issues.Title: build(docs-infra): do not include CI-specific config in docs examples ZIP archives
Issues.Body:
In #35381, a new Protractor config file was introduced in docs examples, `protractor-puppeteer.conf.js`, that was only supposed to be used on CI and not be shipped with the ZIP archives provided for users to download and experiment with the docs examples locally.

The logic to ignore the `protractor-puppeteer.conf.js` file was incorrect, resulting in the file being retained in some examples (e.g. [universal][1]). The problem was not immediately obvious, because most examples explicitly specify all `**/*.js` files as ignored, but for other examples the file was retained in the ZIP archive.

This commit fixes the logic to ensure the file is excluded from all docs examples ZIP archives.

##
This PR also cleans up obsolete properties from `zipper.json` files.
See individual commit messages for more info.

##
Jira issue: [FW-1992][2]

[1]: https://v9.angular.io/generated/zips/universal/universal.zip
[2]: https://angular-team.atlassian.net/browse/FW-1992

[FW-1992]: https://angular-team.atlassian.net/browse/FW-1992
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build(docs-infra): do not include CI-specific config in docs examples ZIP archives" (#36018)

Issues.Title: Spy on jasmine function from an Angular library is not working
Issues.Body:
I have an Angular library containing functions like "export function myFunction".  
The project with the error have this library as a dependency and when I want to spy on the function, the error below is display:

```typescript
myFunction is not declared writable or has no setter
```

**Now the real world example**:

*A simple function from the library:*
```typescript
export function isNotEmptyString(value: any): value is string {
  return _.isString(value) && !_.isEmpty(value);
}
```

*The dts of this function once packaged:*
```typescript
export declare function isNotEmptyString(value: any): value is string;
```

To spy on the function, I must have an object at some point.  
So I use a custom module import to achieve this.

*The spy on error:*
```typescript
import * as MyLibfrom 'my-lib';

const isNotEmptyStringSpy = spyOn(MyLib, 'isNotEmptyString').and.returnValue(false);
```

*And the error is:*
```typescript
isNotEmptyString is not declared writable or has no setter
```

*Now, if I use a `spyOnPropety`:*
```typescript
import * as MyLibfrom 'my-lib';

const isNotEmptyStringSpy = spyOnProperty(MyLib, 'isNotEmptyString').and.returnValue(() => false);
```

*And the new error is:*
```typescript
isNotEmptyString is not declared configurable
```

I also tried to use differents module inside the `tsconfig.json` compiler options.  
Like `commonjs`, `CommonJS`, `ES2015` and `ESNext`.  
There is no difference.

*tsconfig.json*
```typescript
"compilerOptions": {
  "module": "commonjs"
}
```

Does anyone have a suggestion?  
I am stuck with this :/  

Thanks !

*Environment:*
```
"karma": "4.4.1"
"jasmine-core": "3.5.0"
"@angular/core": "9.0.5"
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Spy on jasmine function from an Angular library is not working" (#17207)

Issues.Title: Schematics: Unit testing a rule that uses mergeWith/apply fails due to missing context
Issues.Body:
## Addendum

In creating the test case I've realised that I'm not passing a `partialContext` to `callRule`, so it is definitely missing context, however, it is not at all clear _what_ context is necessary for `mergeWith` to succeed and the error does not indicate that context is actually missing.

Happy for this to be marked as a question instead. Guidance on _how_ to provide the context and _what_ context to provide would be amazingly useful.

# üêû Bug report

### Description

Using `callRule` to unit test rules within a schematic fails when it comes to rules which return `mergeWith`

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

See: https://github.com/jdpearce/schematics-apply-problem

Given a rule which applies template files to the tree, this unit test will fail with `TypeError: Cannot read property 'path' of undefined`:

```ts
describe('applyTemplateFiles Rule', () => {
  let tree: UnitTestTree;

  beforeEach(async () => {
    tree = new UnitTestTree(Tree.empty());
  });

  it('should apply the files to the tree', async () => {
    const schema = {};

    tree = (await callRule(applyTemplateFiles(schema), tree)) as UnitTestTree;

    expect(tree.files).toEqual(jasmine.arrayContaining(['/libs/destination/test.txt']));
  });
});
```

## üî• Exception or Error

```bash
Failures:
1) applyTemplateFiles Rule should apply the files to the tree
  Message:
    TypeError: Cannot read property 'path' of undefined
  Stack:
        at <Jasmine>
        at ./apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/tools/file-system-engine-host-base.js:216:96
        at ./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/url.js:13:73
        at Object.callSource (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/call.js:55:20)
        at ./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/base.js:45:60
        at Object.callSource (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/call.js:55:20)
        at ./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/base.js:53:23
        at MergeMapSubscriber.project (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/call.js:74:24)
        at MergeMapSubscriber._tryNext (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/rxjs/internal/operators/mergeMap.js:69:27)
        at MergeMapSubscriber._next (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/rxjs/internal/operators/mergeMap.js:59:18)
        at MergeMapSubscriber.Subscriber.next (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/rxjs/internal/Subscriber.js:66:18)

2 specs, 1 failure
```

## üåç Your Environment

    "@angular-devkit/schematics": "^9.0.6",
    "@types/jasmine": "^3.3.9",
    "@types/node": "^8.0.31",
    "jasmine": "^3.3.1",

Issues.Title: build: update worker-plugin to version 4.0.2
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [worker-plugin](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin) | dependencies | major | [`3.2.0` -> `4.0.2`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/worker-plugin/3.2.0/4.0.2) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin</summary>

### [`v4.0.2`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin/releases/4.0.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin/compare/4.0.1...4.0.2)

Worker Plugin 4 brings a few nice new features:

##### üöì Support for Webpack's strict ES Modules mode:

Using `.mjs` now works properly with `worker-plugin`, and actually produces better output than the default CommonJS internals ([#​61](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin/issues/61)).

##### üèó A new [worker-plugin/loader](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin#loader) variant:

If you need to compile a module as a standalone set of bundles but don't need the `new Worker` parsing stuff, it's now possible to use this plugin's internal functionality as a loader! Just prefix your import with `worker-plugin/loader!` and you'll get back the bundle's URL. This is useful for bundling things like Worklets:

```js
import workerUrl from 'worker-plugin/loader!./my-paint-worklet';
CSS.paintWorklet.addModule(workerUrl);
```

##### üéõ Support for `SharedWorker`

Pass the `{sharedWorker:true}` option to enable automatic bundling of `SharedWorker`. ([#​42](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin/issues/42) - thanks [@​stutrek](https://togithub.com/stutrek)!).

Similarly, you can also now pass `{worker:false}` to disable automatic bundling of `Worker`. ([#​57](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin/issues/57) - thanks [@​gbmatt](https://togithub.com/gbmatt)!)

##### üêû Bugfix for trailing commas in worker init options

Previously, `new Worker("./foo.js", { type:"module", })` would result in invalid JavaScript output. This has now been fixed. Unless configured to keep the `type` option around, the output is simply `new Worker(bundleUrl)`. ([#​49](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin/issues/49) - thanks [@​arturovt](https://togithub.com/arturovt)!)

### [`v4.0.1`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin/compare/4.0.0...4.0.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin/compare/4.0.0...4.0.1)

### [`v4.0.0`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin/compare/3.2.0...4.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/GoogleChromeLabs/worker-plugin/compare/3.2.0...4.0.0)

</details>

Issues.Title: Show default values for each command flag
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

Today I started a new NG9 project and first things first I have set up CLI commands, packages and so on. While doing that, I was wondering what defaults are being set by the CLI and couldn't find any reference in the docs.

Let's say `ng serve --hmr`, is HMR not enabled by default? Those are questions I ask myself and I think others that are starting with NG as well. To make that easier. We should add the default value behind every flag:

```
ng server --help
...
  --hmr
    Enable hot module replacement. (default: true)
```

At the moment my command looks like that:

```
ng serve --watch --live-reload --aot --hmr --open --progress --source-map
```

Because I'm not sure if any of them are true by default. Sure, I expect them to be true but I'm not sure. My previous projects were developed through Ionic CLI which had handled that `ng serve` under the hood.


### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [x] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [x] test
- [x] e2e
- [x] generate
- [x] add
- [x] update
- [x] lint
- [x] xi18n
- [x] run
- [x] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Describe alternatives you've considered

A note in the docs

Issues.Title: build: update to typescript v3.8
Issues.Body:
Updates to TypeScript v3.8. To ensure that Angular Components is still
compatible with older supported TypeScript versions, a new integration
test has been introduced.

Unlike in `angular/angular`, our packages have a _lot_ more entry-points, so manually
creating files that import all entry-points for the compatibility test is not suitable. This
required a more dynamic and less verbose solution.

Also, audited all TypeScript AST work to check for the new AST changes from v3.8. It looks like there is no action needed, but the `class-name` `ng-update` rule seems to need a general cleanup to handle namespaced exports/imports better. Added a comment w/ JIRA ticket.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update to typescript v3.8" (#18789)

Issues.Title: build: ensure correct toolchains used for remote execution
Issues.Body:
Currently the toolchains used for RBE are dependent on the current platform.
This breaks because the remote executors are `k8` based, and the default
`bazel-toolchain` configurations do not work for anything except `k8` or `armeabi-v7a`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: ensure correct toolchains used for remote execution" (#18803)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimetal/mdc-form-field): account for breaking changes in MDC
Issues.Body: In https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/commit/8639c269010b77b17f1a5052d57abcb5f7d2892a MDC reworked how their heights and paddings are set up, causing a compilation error on our end. These changes account for the new setup.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material-experimetal/mdc-form-field): account for breaking changes in MDC" (#18795)

Issues.Title: fix(input/testing): unable to set the value of inputs that don't respond to typing
Issues.Body:
The `setValue` method of the input harness is set up so that it types out the value in the input. This won't work for inputs that don't respond to typing (e.g. `color`). These changes add an extra call that also sets the `value` property of the input, on top of typing into it.

Fixes #18790.

Note: not sure whether the change to the `TestElement` signature needs to be made optional first.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(input/testing): unable to set the value of inputs that don't respond to typing" (#18812)

Issues.Body:
Hi,

I'm facing an issue on my current project. I'm using mat-select on an angular page, one of which has the `multiple` attribute. My issue is that users can select all checkboxes/options by using the shortcut Ctrl + A which I would like to disable as they shouldn't be able to do it.

I have tried everything I could think of including catching directly the KeyDown event to prevent it, but it appears that Material still reacts to it. Do you have any idea of how I could prevent that from happening ?

Thanks in advance

PS: sorry if this post is at the wrong place, it's actually my first GitHub post :d

Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-pefszd

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click to open dialog.
2. Click big button in dialog.
3. click handler is executed only on second click
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Alert from (click) handler


#### Actual Behavior

Alert opens only the second time the button is pressed.

It works fine if any of these changes are done:
- ngFor over an array field, instead of a method returning the array.
- element in the array is a number instead of an object
- remove the ok button

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/coercion): add the support for readonly array coercion

Fixes a type definition of coerceArray so that it accepts both mutable and

Issues.Title: bug(cdk): coerceArray doesn't work with readonly arrays
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-axn4qw?embed=1&file=src/app/example-component.ts&view=editor
2. TS compile error appears
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

`coerceArray` should preserve the readonly array.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
An error:

```
Argument of type 'readonly number[]' is not assignable to parameter of type 'number | number[]'.
  The type 'readonly number[]' is 'readonly' and cannot be assigned to the mutable type 'number[]'.
```

#### Environment

_dependencies from stackblitz_

- Angular: 9.0.2
- CDK/Material: 9.1.0

#### My thoughts


Type definition is:

```ts
export declare function coerceArray<T>(value: T | T[]): T[];
```

I think it should b:

```ts
export declare function coerceArray<T>(value: T | readonly T[]): T[];
```

This way it would accept both mutable and readonly arrays.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk): coerceArray doesn't work with readonly arrays" (#18806)

Issues.Title: bug(material/input): style messy and buggy with Angular Element
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

I have create a github repo for this performance issue from angular material, here is the link https://github.com/jimkeecn/buildxactDemo

the problem in the repo is. I have created an angular element with a mat-input and mat-table. after building the angular element and used in other project. the mat-input is buggy, the placeholder will not move up while the input is focus and filled. Also the pagination of the mat-table is not working at the very start until i have trigger some detect change, however the pagination has slow reaction after click and werid styling and flicking of texts.

Steps to reproduce:
1. download the repo.
2. open the index.html in folder /I am outside of the project/
3. you will see the performance of the angular material input and table.
4. the component is actually in library project folder /search-page
5. angular element is in external project folder /app-component

 
 
#### Expected Behavior

I was expecting to see the mat-input will run smooth like it running without building as angular elements.
I was expecting the mat-table pagination is working, and pagination button is clickable.


#### Actual Behavior

mat-input
placeholder is not lifted up after the field is focus or filled.
pagination forward and backward button is not clickable 
pagination dropdown is not clickable


#### Environment

- Angular: ~9.0.3
- Angular/elements: ^9.0.4
- CDK/Material: ^9.1.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(material/input): style messy and buggy with Angular Element" (#18805)

Issues.Title: fix(select): don't select active item when tabbing away while closed
Issues.Body:
When the user tabs away from a select, we pick out the active option automatically. The problem is that we weren't checking that the select is open so in some cases the user might be tabbing through and selecting something by accident.

Fixes #18784.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(select): don't select active item when tabbing away while closed" (#18797)

Issues.Title: [mat-select] Mousedown on mat-select option causes focus on separate mat-form-field when contained in overlay components
Issues.Body:
Example here: https://github.com/reed-lawrence/ionic-sticky-routes

#### Actual Behavior

When intiating mousedown a mat-select option on any overlay component such as a modal, it will focus the first mat-form-field in the component.

![Screen Shot 2020-03-11 at 4 48 57 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30061591/76468771-c184e380-63ba-11ea-8b6e-1d148160ef88.png)

In the above example I am clicking the mat-option within the mat-select and you can see that it is focusing the mat-form-field unrelated to the mat-select.

This behavior is NOT present in non-overlay containers. 

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Safari & Chrome
- Operating System: macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[mat-select] Mousedown on mat-select option causes focus on separate mat-form-field when contained in overlay components" (#18796)

"@angular/core": "~8.2.14", "@angular/material": "^8.2.3",
